sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Miscellaneous Treatises and Sermons on Indulgences and Confession (Vols. II, III). Petrus Aureoli OFM, Compendium litterale totius scripture (Vol. IV). John of Genoa OP, Catholicon (Vol. V)
Ioh. Cassianus. Ric. Armachanus etc.
msDesc.p:
Paper and vellum, 300 210
11.8 x 8.2, ff. 74 + 113 + 115 + 99 + 21. Cent. xv and xvi, several volumes in various hands.

Volume I: Printed material, now bound separately as CCCC Parker Library: SP 322A.
Volume III:Outer and middle sheets vellum: the rest paper. (Water-mark: a ring with pointed bezel.) 42 lines to a page. Cent. xv, the latter part in good clear hand.
Volume IV: Vellum, double columns of 38 lines. Cent. xv, ugly small current hand, ff. 99.
Volume V: Paper and vellum, triple columns. Cent. xv late, in a bad hand, 21 ff.

Collation:
Volume III: A16 (wants 1, 8) B20 (wants one in 1st half) C20 (wants 3 at end) D20-F20 G (three).
Volume IV: a12-h12 i (three).
Volume V: a12 (middle sheet vellum) b10 (wants 10).

msItem.head: John Cassian, Collationes (excerpt)

head.title: Fragmentum collationum Iohannis Cassiani, liber impressus

msItem.explicit: secunda collatio abbatis sereni de principatibus
msItem.ab: Printed by the Fratres vitae communis: Proctor 9935, Campbell 399, Hain 4561

ab.supplied: Since the M. R. James catalogue this printed book has been bound separately as CCCC Parker Library SP 322A and it has therefore not been imaged

msItem.head: Paul II, Bull regarding feast days (1467)

head.title: Bulla Pauli papae II de observantia dierum festorum dat. 1467

msItem.incipit: Perniciosa consuetudo

msItem.head: Paul II, Bull regarding excommunication (1467)

head.title: Bulla ejusdem papae denuntians sententiam excommunicationis. contra omnes hereticos et cetera data kalendis Aprilis 1467

msItem.incipit: Consueuerunt Romani pontifices

ab.supplied: Fol. 3r-3v has been misbound; it should follow fol. 4v and is part of the next item

msItem.head: Hucbald of Saint-Amand OSB, Ecloga de caluis

head.title: Versus Hu(c)baldi de laude calvorum

ab.supplied: The text begins on fol. 4v, continues on fol. 3r-3v and then fol. 5r-6r. Fol. 6v is blank

msItem.rubric: Incipit versus hubaldi de laude caluorum quos G. compleuit
msItem.incipit: Carmina clarisone caluis cantate camene
msItem.explicit:
Clausula completur commendans carmine caluos.
Amen. Alleluya.
Ter quinquagenos cecinit dauid ordine psalmos
Ostendit caluos opus hoc tot versibus almos

head.title: Expositio regulae S. Benedicti de peculio monachorum

msItem.incipit: In nomine etc. Pro salute eorum qui vicia fugere cupiunt
msItem.ab: A proof that monacho nec proprium licet habere nec peculium excepta causa administracionis
The above is a quire of 16 leaves: three are cut out

msItem.incipit: Quia vero de indulgencia fit sermo ideo primo videamus

head.title: Utrum principi terrenorum necessaria sit peritia literarum
Utrum principi terrenorum necessaria sit peritia literarum

msItem.head: François de Meyronnes OFM, De subiectione principatus

head.title: Utrum iste qui principatur secundum jurisdictionem universalem tanquam monarcha debeat de jure naturali subjacere illi qui principatur secundum plenitudinem potestatis in spiritualibus quoad omnia, qui dicitur ierarcha

msItem.incipit: Utrum ... secundum jurisdictionem universalem etc.

head.title: Sermon on the Pardon of Syon

msItem.rubric: Here begynnyth a sermon of pardon and specially of the pardon of Syon
msItem.incipit: Tibi dabo claues regni celorum mtas in euangelio huius festiuitatis et pro themate hodierno
The gospell of this fest tellith howe oure lord askede of his disciples etc.

msItem.head: Mansuetus, Epistola ad Constantinum

head.title: Epistola incompleta Mansueti Medicanensis episcopi ad Constantem imperatorem

msItem.incipit: Quicquid (?) Augustinus omni sapientia clarus siue ambrosius
msItem.explicit: non erit finis. Quod videre nos faciat J. C. Amen
msItem.ab: Mansuetus Abp of Milan (for Medicanensis read Mediolanensis) wrote the Epistle to Constantine Pogonatus in 679. It is prefixed to the Acts of the Sixth Council (A. D. 680)

msItem.head: Antoninus Florentinus (Antonino Pierozzi) OP, De instructione confessoris

head.title: De potestate confessorum

msItem.incipit: Defecerunt scrutantes scrutineo ait psalmista
msItem.explicit: in aliis doctoribus et tanguntur in summa maystracia

head.title: De restitutione

msItem.incipit: Circa materiam restitucionis seu satisfactionis notandum

msItem.head: Iohannes de Turrecremata (Juan de Torquemada) OP, Meditationes (Contemplationes)

head.title: Orationes

msItem.incipit: Quando deus creauit celum et terram et omnia que in eis sunt
O admiranda et laudanda tue dispensacionis gratia
msItem.ab: After one De S. Trinitate, follows (f. 103v)
msItem.incipit: S. Dominicus, Innocencius papa 5us, S. Thomas, Raymundus, S. Petrus martir, Durandus, Benedictus papa xius, Albertus, Vlricus, S. Vincencius, Herueus
Felix vitis de cuius surculo
msItem.explicit: Oratio autoris Iohannis de turre cremata cardinalis S. Sixti [qui obiit circa a. d. 1465]: these words marked vacat
msItem.incipit: Gloriosus certe et mirabilis in S. Sixto
msItem.ab: The last is on Commemoratio animarum

msItem.head: Robert Grosseteste, Sermon preached before Innocent IV at Lyon

msItem.incipit: Dominus noster Ihesus Christus eternus eterni dei patris filius de secretissimo sinu patris
msItem.explicit: a me peccatorum extreme est attemptatum

msItem.head: Innocent IV, Letter to the archdeacon of Canterbury

head.title: Literae Innocentii iv. ad archidiaconum Cant. et Innocentium collectorem suum in Anglia, ut nepotem suum Fredericum de Lavania in canonicatum in ecclesia Lincoln, proximo vacaturum, inducant

msItem.ab: See Luard, Rob. Grosseteste Epp. (Rolls), p. 432 note

msItem.head: Robert Grosseteste, Epistola 128

head.title: Responsio episcopi Lincoln, in qua probat talem provisionem esse contra voluntatem et cultum Dei, ideoque negat se concessurum

msItem.incipit: Nouerit discrecio uestra quod mandatis apostolicis
msItem.explicit: et non pater domini mei Ihesu Christi qui est in celis
msItem.incipit: Cum hec epistola ad noticiam pape peruenisset
msItem.ab: notice of death of Grosseteste and signs accompanying it
msItem.explicit: confidenter tamen dico quia plus deo placuerunt virtutes quam displicuerunt excessus. quod nunc per miracula ad tumbam eius manifestatur coruscantia

msItem.head: William of Ockham OFM (attrib.), Disputatio super potestate praelatis ecclesiae atque principibus terrarum commissa (Disputatio inter clericum et militem)

head.title: Disputatio inter clericum et militem super potestate commissa prelatis ecclesiasticis atque principibus terrarum

msItem.incipit: Primo proponit clericus iuramentum dictum quodammodo sub hac forma. Clericus. Miror optime miles paucis diebus

head.title: Tractatus totius bibliae expositorius, compendiose editus a Mag. Petro de Aureolis fratre minore et doctore sacrae theologiae Parisiensi

msItem.incipit: Venite ascendamus ad montem domini etc. Gregorius 23 libro moralium exponens
msItem.explicit: mirre et thuris et uniuersi pulueris pigmentarii
